title: Which fictional character can you connect yourself to? - Quora

response.answer_text: In reality, I am not even close to MIKE ROSS’s character from SUITS but my some of my friends/colleagues/ other people often relate me to that character. Little Background: I’m a civil engineer with a post graduation in Advanced Construction Management. I work with Hindustan Construction Company as a Senior Contracts Engineer. I usually spend my free time writing answers related to civil engineering and related topics here. (Quora) Many people found those answers interesting and helpful. I get many messages (Quora) thanking me for my answers. These messages made me really happy :) From Akshara:  Message reads, Thank you for the response. That was really helpful. After reading most of your answers, I can relate you to Mike Ross’s character - SUITS (TV Series) —————————————————- From Sumanth:  Message reads, I watched suits TV show I related Mike Ross to your character , you must be Mike Ross to your boss I guess that's how you became sr contract engineer in short time , only difference might be Mike didn't have degree you have perfect degree ha ha you must be assets to your boss \U0001f44d Cheers Sumanth How do I connect to Mike Ross:  Mike Ross found school incredibly easy due to his eidetic memory.I do have some photographic memory but no way close to Mike Ross. (I can recollect a mobile number after a decade)His area of expertise is law.I deal with law related to construction.Harvey Specter: His BOSS is awesome.I have a cool boss too.He saved the firm (he’s working with) several times.I got 6 months project extension from my client (for 20 months project). Kind of saved the firm I am working with :D———————————————————————— DISSIMILARITIES: Mike Ross smokes pot (occasionally)I never smoke.Mike Ross has a Girlfriend (Rachel Zane).I have Roles and Responsibilities :PThanks for asking :)

1.Elizabeth Benett   A dysfunctional family and confusing love life coupled with quick wit thereby making (sometimes) unfair judgments and biased opinions? Yup totally connect with that 2.Carl Anheuser- 2012   Talk about being misunderstood!Throughout the movie all he did was for the benefit of humanity and yet he was always everyone ended up hating.His cold and calculating mind did nothing wrong I mean look at the situations- The bloke is literally in charge of the giant operation to save the world, and all he does is get stick from the heroes about it. They tell him off for saving only the richest people and putting them on the mega-arks, when he offers the legitimate reasoning that they actually helped pay for the boat so they deserve their precious spaces, goddamnit. He’s told off for not letting everyone know about the impending apocalypse, despite the fact it would cause nothing but panicking, violence and the slowing down of the rescue efforts. Finally, and most memorably, he doesn’t want to risk the safety of the ark to save one insignificant family, which is surely only logical. Everything this man does, he does to save others. I remember watching the movie and wondering this is exactly what I would have done! 3..Draco Malfoy   No I am not a proud,sarcastic ,rude bully like him.But the part of him that loves his father dearly,the part which tries his best to make his father like and appreciate him, the part of him that just wants to make his father proud of him, I connect with that. 4.Magneto   Unlike Charles who had a relatively safe childhood, Erik grew up alone in a world where mutants were looked down upon. He did all he could to ensure that the mutant kind would never feel that way. He has done some terrible things but he did have a point. 5.Coyote   Man,he was just hungry!!! 6.Katniss Everdeen   Everyone relates to her.I think. .
